page.title: 08Attitudes in rural Sowerby
page.content: One farmer's wife offered the following comments.She said that farmers are often regarded by the general public as the fortunate, affluent community living in the countryside, in fresh air, and away from fuel fumes, dust and the everlasting noise of traffic. Farmers in our block cannot claim these privileges, with an airfield, a heavily used Trunk road, and a main railway line from Newcastle to London, crossing the area. We are living in a highly competitive era. Supermarket purchasing policies, freezers, microwave ovens have all combined to put the entire food spectrum in a different league. There is a noticeable change in our sense of taste, and our younger generation do not enjoy the tastes of our forbears.
